bug.author: misssprite
bug.summary: Plotly choropleth figure not displayed properly.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
plotly choropleth figure not displayed properly. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
import streamlit as st import plotly.express as px
df = px.data.election() geojson = px.data.election_geojson()
fig = px.choropleth(df, geojson=geojson, color="Bergeron", locations="district", featureidkey="properties.district", projection="mercator" ) fig.update_geos(fitbounds="locations", visible=False) fig.update_layout(margin={"r":0,"t":0,"l":0,"b":0}) st.plotly_chart(fig) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1622709/74604526-de9aff00-50f9-11ea-94d3-919900d3fe20.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1622709/74604530-e490e000-50f9-11ea-85ce-e603c836b81f.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
not sure <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.56.0 Python version: Python 3.6.2 :: Continuum Analytics, Inc. (in win10), python 3.7 (in docker container with base image python:3.7) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: win 10, docker on CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core) Browser version: Google Chrome 79.0.3945.130 (64bit), Firefox 72.0.2 (64 bit)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For example, did this bug come from <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io>https://discuss.streamlit.io</denchmark-link> or another site? Link the original source here!

comments.comment: Thanks, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/misssprite>@misssprite</denchmark-link> ! Our plotly.js library was out of date. I've updated it in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1119>#1119</denchmark-link> ; this should go out in a release soon.

Is there a way to re-open this issue? It is still not working on Windows systems. I'm currently working on a choropleth map and spent nearly a day figuring it out, when I accidently put it on my Linux server, where it was running fine....

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MattMacs>@MattMacs</denchmark-link> , can you provide the following info?
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
Are there any error messages in the developer console of your browser?

Hi, thanks for the fast reply. Just as you mentioned streamlit version, I saw my error. On Windows I still had 0.56, on Linux 0.57... After the upgrade on Windows everything works like a charm. Sorry for the disruption.
